alert.note: Alert for Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 15 at 4:26PM PST until December 16 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter Storm to bring Snow to the Mountains and Foothills through Thursday... .A strong winter storm will continue to impact Northern California today through Thursday bringing heavy mountain snow and gusty winds to the area. Snow levels will range from 1000 to 2000 today, gradually rising on Thursday. Significant travel delays and difficult mountain/foothill travel are anticipated. Strong winds will further reduce visibilities during this event with local whiteout conditions possible. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the evening commute. Tree branches could fall as well. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches, with localized amounts up to 1 foot, are expected. * WHERE...Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County. * WHEN...Until 10 AM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County
